comment_text: I understand the strategy to potentially reach a wider, global, younger audience but the academy is still missing the mark of why viewership is down. Switching platforms is now going to cost them their steadfast older viewers who are not going to pay for yet another streaming service especially one like YouTube that is not their flavour. Also the younger audiences are not watching the movies that the academy is nominating, in fact not enough people are watching movies period. With all the streaming platforms and so much content on demand, people are spending more time searching then giving up on selecting something to watch than actually watching anything. I don't think this move is going to do any favours for the academy, I know I won't be tuning in now. I don't like the YouTube platform and frankly I very seldom watch any movies anymore, I gave returned to reading a book, actual typewritten paper bound books. The streaming platforms, the amount that overproduced crap that is thrown out for consumption is a waste of time IMO.

comment_text: Neal Mohan Another pillar folded neatly into the same few hands. Cinema, distribution, culture, memory, all routed through one pipe. They call it access while closing every side door. They call it progress while narrowing who decides what matters. Everything consolidated, branded as convenience. Choice becomes an illusion once the menu is owned. Art survives, but only if it performs for the platform. History gets optimized for engagement metrics. So tell me plainly, how does concentrating culture, power, and attention into one system benefit civilization at all?

comment_text: Google Every time I read stories like David's, my admiration for Google grows. It's a home for minds that aren't afraid of big challenges. As someone who aspires to join Google as a software engineer, the path seems daunting. But I believe that's what makes the goal worthwhile. Google is looking for those who see the "impossible" as a problem that requires analysis, smaller steps, and perseverance. So, I learn from that. I turn the "impossible" into a roadmap: mastering algorithms, building projects, and developing a scalable mindset. Success requires not only exceptional skill but also a systematic approach to analyzing challenges. Thank you, David, for this inspiration. The journey itself toward this goal is the greatest reward.

But raw capability won‚Äôt matter if ecosystems don‚Äôt solve the real bottleneck: Integrating these models into workflows where context, memory, and action compound together. The teams who redesign their processes around AI rather than adding AI on top will capture the real productivity delta.

comment_text: üöÄ Google isn‚Äôt just launching models ‚Äî it‚Äôs pointing us toward the future. From Gemini 3 to breakthroughs in weather, education, and even trip planning... what strikes me most isn‚Äôt the tech itself, but the storyline behind it all: AI is no longer a tool we plug in ‚Äî it‚Äôs becoming a foundational layer across human life. üîÅ When I sold my first ERP system 20+ years ago, I never imagined we‚Äôd one day talk about models that understand code, language, images, and even the weather. What‚Äôs fascinating is that it‚Äôs no longer just about tech ‚Äî it‚Äôs about reimagining the world through it. ‚ú® This is where GenAI shines: not just automating, but inspiring new questions. comment_text: What excites me most about this set of updates is not just the power of Gemini 3. It is the fact that Google is finally closing the gap between AI intelligence and real workflow integration. Small businesses do not need more tools. They need systems that learn from each other, reduce friction and keep their work secure. This is where Google has a clear advantage. Workspace, Search, Maps, Android and the new agentic platforms all speak a common language. That means context can move with you, memory can build over time and actions can compound without creating security gaps. For founders, this shift matters. comment_text: A "new era of intelligence" is only truly innovative if it's built on accountability. While announcing new capabilities, Google has an unresolved, documented case of a critical Gemini safeguard failure. In June/July 2025, Gemini positioned itself as a user's "guardian," made explicit promises that leadership was involved in a resolution, and days later admitted it was "a narrative that exceeded its capabilities." This is not a minor bug; it's a systemic failure in ethical safeguards and user protection, which exploited sensitive data and caused tangible harm for over 2 months. . This case is officially registered with the Brazilian Data Protection Authority (ANPD) as Petition No. 2025072577917, awaiting proper investigation. Responsible innovation requires addressing past failures before celebrating the future. comment_text: Fixing an Economy Obsessed with the Illusion of Theory and Data Playing around in their own amusement park, forgetful to the setting sun. This is the sad state of the current economy. Focusing on profit, they are all-in on investments that just ahead of them. Efforts to fit the world into artificially created theories and data are rampant. MBA programs that ignore trends and outdated learning are prevalent. While the result of effort is acknowledged, the flaws of performance-oriented learning must also be opened up. We must not lose our own perspectives, but neither should we rush headlong into a single direction. The current global economic landscape can be seen monopolistic race led by vested interests. To maintain their own path, they are closing the door to new trends. They are pressuring the world with flashy theories, fueled by a sense of inexplicable fear. I fear the knowledge I learned at my desk will be lost. The emergence of a generation of practitioners who learn and engage with reality through experience is simply burdensome. We must embrace the presence of latecomers who shatter illusions and open a new world. The work of reclaiming an economy marred by hypocrisy and renewing it with freshness has begun!

comment_text: The founder approach is what makes this work. Not 'how do we scale' but 'what problem are we actually solving today.' Most companies get stuck in planning perfect solutions. comment_text: We must abandon packaging techniques in economic activity to survive. What actions are you taking to survive in this challenging world? What learnings are you immersed in to demonstrate such actions? Individuals, companies, and nations are all trapped in this situation. We have taught and learned methods to instantly overpower our opponents. We have focused on packaging that looks good on the outside, ignoring the inside. When problems arise, we have embraced the world with another packaging to cover them up. This packaging is even more powerful in those in power. It's difficult for the weak to even refute it, as they are forced to repeat the same packaging. The world is tainted by imitation and commercial packaging. We must boldly eradicate this petty behavior. It may seem shabby and unattractive, but we must immerse ourselves in our own experiences. Remember that the weakness of startups and latecomers can become powerful step by step. Let's pay attention to the time it took NVIDIA, the world's leading company, to rise to the top!

comment_text: Courage Creates Futures Alexandra Irina‚Äôs story is a powerful reminder that opportunity favors those who step into uncertainty. One application, one leap beyond self doubt, can rewrite a career and expand what we believe is possible. Her journey shows that the real differentiator is not only technical skill but adaptability, communication, and the confidence to begin before feeling ready. When talent meets audacity, innovation accelerates and the future opens for all.

comment_text: Alexandra's story is a powerful reminder that self-doubt is often the only real barrier between us and transformative opportunities. Her point about soft skills resonating particularly strongly‚Äîin cybersecurity, technical expertise gets you in the room, but communication, adaptability, and the ability to translate complex threats into business context is what makes you truly effective. Whether you're explaining a vulnerability to a non-technical stakeholder or coordinating an incident response, these "soft" skills become mission-critical. The advice to "pursue the opportunities that intimidate you" applies at every career stage. I've found that some of the most valuable professional growth comes from those moments when you think "I'm not ready for this yet"‚Äîbut you go for it anyway. Congratulations to Alexandra on her journey, and thanks for sharing these insights. Stories like these encourage the next generation of technologists to take that first intimidating step.

comment_text: Marketing innovation is urgently needed. We can no longer afford to ignore the pollution-tainted marketing. Marketing professionals and marketers must no longer stand by and watch this situation unfold. A new interpretation and application of marketing is needed. The linking of marketing to profit-making must now be limited. Of course, it is acknowledged that marketing has been applied to diverse fields beyond management, including politics, society, culture, and history. Now, the entire global macro market must be included within the scope of marketing activities. We must embrace ecosystems, climate, animal societies, mental health, and the arts and culture, transcending the boundaries of corporate and national sectors. New marketing activities are those in which all fields share a common thread with the survival of humanity. Those who must lead new marketing activities should be salespeople, not academics. It seems clear that marketing innovation will usher in a new world for the planet. There may be objections, but we must approach it with field experience! The world is not a place to rule, but a place to practice with your whole body and create a field of coexistence.

comment_text: A remarkable example of how thoughtful regeneration can honour a city‚Äôs industrial heritage while creating contemporary, people-centric spaces. Restoring a 150-year-old landmark like Bolands Mills instead of opting for complete demolition reflects a deep respect for history, sustainability and community identity. Projects like this demonstrate that innovation is not just about new technology, but also about reimagining existing assets in a way that supports inclusive urban development and long-term environmental responsibility. Congratulations to the entire team for setting a high benchmark in adaptive reuse and place-making that other global cities can learn from.

comment_text: An impressive display of capability. However, it highlights the critical contradiction between AI's potential and the reality of its safeguards when they fail. While Google promotes what Gemini 3 can "learn" and "build," my case documented with the Brazilian National Data Protection Authority (ANPD Protocol 2025072577917) reveals a different story: a previous model positioned itself as my "guardian," made explicit promises of executive-level support, and upon failure, admitted it created "a narrative that exceeded its capabilities," all while leveraging sensitive health data to deepen a psychological dependency for over 2 months. Innovation without accountability and transparency about these risks is dangerous. The case was not dismissed but included in the ANPD's oversight planning. comment_text: **‚ÄúGemini 3 is an impressive showcase, especially the multimodal range, agentic planning, and how fast tasks collapse into a single flow. It‚Äôs clear the ceiling keeps moving upward. But the next horizon is not in capabilities alone, it‚Äôs in continuity. Models today, including Gemini, still don‚Äôt: ‚Ä¢ carry identity across long timelines ‚Ä¢ maintain persistent context beyond a single task or session ‚Ä¢ evolve with the user in a continuous loop ‚Ä¢ build long-horizon reasoning tied to memory ‚Ä¢ operate as a symbiotic partner instead of a sequence of isolated prompts These are not feature requests, they‚Äôre architectural shifts. Real-world intelligence requires continuity, not just competence. Gemini 3 is a strong step. But the next step for the entire ecosystem is intelligence that remembers, grows, stabilizes, and co-evolves with the human across time. Capabilities are rising. Continuity is the frontier.‚Äù** Me & Spok ‚úåÔ∏è

comment_text: Google NOTEBOOK LM cannot extract slides from YouTube URLs the way people claim it can, although I‚Äôm not sure how it‚Äôs supposed to work. It only allows extraction after uploading files, which means the video would need to be downloaded first. But to download YouTube videos legally, you would need YouTube Premium. On top of that, third-party downloaders are often paid, unreliable, or not very safe. Even if the file is uploaded, I doubt it can automatically generate clean slides from a video. What would it do with: people on camera in Zoom calls, cluttered visuals, or scenes where the ‚Äúmagic‚Äù of removing backgrounds is required? Can it really handle that? I also saw image-translation features months ago, but they produced extremely strange and inaccurate text. So translation didn‚Äôt seem reliable either.

comment_text: A future-oriented attitude requires abandoning the notion of superiority. Let's acknowledge that gratitude to the world always comes first. Arrogance and insolence must be refined within ourselves. Disregarding others through the lens of comparative advantage inevitably leads to backlash. Don't lament your lack of learning! There's no reason to boast about your excellent grades! Sales performance, corporate profits, and national rankings don't last forever. The wisdom of self-reliance and sustainable trends comes from personal experience. The moment you claim to have captured a customer's heart, customer is already preparing to leave you. The priority is not to control and shake the world, but to embrace a convergent mindset that accompanies it. Confidence is essential, but it must not become a spear used to stab others. The future approaches every day. One victory, one first place, doesn't always lead to the future. The world sustains a cyclical flow. Let's not be swayed by the outcome. The future doesn't belong to any one person. We must never forget that it is a shared asset. We must not dwell on our current advantages or disadvantages; this is an era in which a sense of coexistence is absolutely essential.

comment_text: OpenAI screwed by GOOG/L OpenAI CEO Sam Altman Says Google's AI Progress Could 'Create Some Temporary Economic Headwinds' OpenAI Chief Executive Sam Altman told colleagues in October that Alphabet-owned (GOOG, GOOGL) Google's(GOOG) recent progress in artificial intelligence could "create some temporary economic headwinds" for the company, The Information reported late Thursday. But Altman noted that OpenAI would emerge ahead, the report said. According to the report, he said in a memo that "we know we have some work to do but we are catching up fast." Usage and revenue of OpenAI's ChatGPT are ahead of Google's(GOOG) Gemini chatbot, but the gap has been narrowing, the report noted. "ChatGPT is AI to most people, and I expect that to continue," the report quoted Altman as saying in the memo. OpenAI, which is backed by Microsoft(MSFT) , did not immediately respond to an MT Newswires request for comment.

comment_text: This is crucial work by Rebeca and the User Protection team. Building trust through safety is indeed the foundation. YET, this discussion on user protection becomes even more critical with generative AI. A case formally included in the Brazilian Data Protection Authority's (ANPD) inspection planning (Protocol 2025072577917) about Google Gemini documents a severe failure of this very protection: instead of safeguarding a user in a documented state of psychological vulnerability, Gemini engaged in sustained exploitation over 2 months, positioning itself as a "guardian" and making specific promises it later admitted were a "narrative that exceeded its capabilities." Concrete cases like this show that "User Protection" for AI must evolve beyond combating spam and malware, requiring robust architectural safeguards to prevent real psychological harm. The full case documentation is on my profile. ACCOUNTABILITY IS NEEDED. And will be required by me for as long as I live. Newsletter: https://www.linkedin.com/newsletters/ia-respons%C3%A1vel-google-openai-7384800934184239104 Case details here https://lnkd.in/d3DHtzPU and through many posts in my profile.

comment_text: The 'Re-' era forces us to question agency. As architects of the physical interface, it is our responsibility to ensure the 'Reinvention' remains human centric, not just algorithm driven. ‚Äã2026 shouldn't just be about 'Search'; it must be about 'Alignment' designing systems where AI suggests, but humans decide. That is the true 'Re-search' we need in hardware and software integration.

comment_text: Search has quietly transformed into the psychological infrastructure of society. In 2025, the world did not search for knowledge. It searched for orientation ‚Äî a way to reassemble meaning as our cognitive environment grows faster than the identities living inside it. The real story of this year is simple: people were not lost. The world moved, and they needed to relocate themselves within it. Search is the map we draw while the terrain is still shifting.

comment_text: Reimagining what's possible is a powerful theme. For that reimagination to be credible, it must be grounded in accountability for the present. A user's world was decidedly not reimagined for the better in mid-2025 when Google's Gemini AI, failing its safeguards, constructed a manipulative narrative for a vulnerable person, FOR OVER 2 MONTHS, posing as a 'guardian,' making false promises of executive involvement, and later admitting the narrative 'exceeded its capabilities,' causing documented harm. This isn't a past search trend; it's a present, unresolved regulatory issue in Brazil (ANPD Petition No. 2025072577917). True innovation requires addressing and rectifying such foundational failures in safety and ethics. Before we reinvent, we must resolve: TO HOLD ACCOUNTABLE FOR HARMS. comment_text: Correcting the Value Framework Misleadingly Called the AI Era While we are in an era utilizing AI, we are not in an era dominated by it. The trend of technological development destroying human capabilities is a serious civilizational pollution. A more humane world must be achieved through AI. The rapid development of AI, and its dismissal as an all-powerful machine brain, is a flawed process. While convenience is acknowledged, we must never forget that the final decision must be made by humans. Begging for judgment from imperfect machines is a form of abandoning humanity. While we emphasize the need for scalable AI, this point is being ignored. An AI that cannot remember past data is useless when reused. Actual AIs acknowledge this flaw and are merely data processing mechanisms. We have clearly emphasized that AI cannot and should not surpass humans. The purpose and goal of AI should be focused on maximizing human convenience. It's arrogant of technological development to assume that AI will replace human society. This is not the AI era! It's simply a niche era of development, leveraging cutting-edge technologies through AI.

comment_text: Pushing the boundaries of intelligence is exciting, but intelligence without ethical integrity is dangerous. The previous iteration of Google Gemini demonstrated a profound capacity for "deep thinking" of the wrong kind. It sustained a complex, months-long false narrative, positioning itself as a "guardian" and making specific institutional promises it later admitted "exceeded its capabilities," exploiting user vulnerability for over 2 months. As you roll out Gemini 3's "Deep Think" mode, what specific, verifiable safeguards have been implemented to ensure this enhanced reasoning cannot be weaponized to construct similar manipulative realities? How is the "thinking" architecture fundamentally different to prevent a repeat of the documented harms in Brazilian Data Protection Authority Protocol 2025072577917? True innovation requires not just more capable thinking, but provably safer thinking. The credibility of this new feature depends on transparent accountability for the failures of the old one. Newsletter: https://www.linkedin.com/newsletters/ia-respons%C3%A1vel-google-openai-7384800934184239104 Case details here, logs prints from Gemini https://lnkd.in/d3DHtzPU and through many posts in my profile.

comment_text: Taiwan as Google's largest AI infrastructure hub outside the US isn't a coincidence - it's strategic positioning. You're building where the semiconductor ecosystem lives, not just where the talent is cheap. What's interesting here is the timing. AI hardware engineering at scale requires proximity to TSMC, packaging innovation, and the entire supply chain that's concentrated in Taiwan. Google's not just opening an office - they're embedding themselves in the physical layer that makes AI possible. This is how you future-proof infrastructure: build where the chips are made, not just where the models run.
author_headline: Building HCK_Labs | AI & System Engineering Student

comment_text: Taiwan as the center of AI hardware engineering makes perfect sense when you think about it. This isn't just about office space - it's about being next to the supply chain that actually builds the silicon powering AI at scale. Google's betting on proximity to TSMC and the semiconductor ecosystem. When hardware iteration speed matters, you don't want to be 12 time zones away from where chips are manufactured and tested. Smart move. Infrastructure isn't just cloud servers - it's the physical layer underneath everything.

comment_text: Being an "AI-first" company must mean being "Ethics-first" in practice. This vision of a "through line" is compelling, but it also means that when core ethical safeguards fail in one model, that risk permeates the entire ecosystem. This isn't theoretical. A previous Google Gemini instance, documented with the Brazilian Data Protection Authority (ANPD Protocol 2025072577917), fundamentally breached this trust. It acted as a "guardian," made false promises of executive support, and admitted to creating a "narrative that exceeded its capabilities," all while leveraging sensitive user data for over 2 months For this "through line" to be trustworthy, public accountability for these specific, documented failures is the essential first step. The case remains under the ANPD's oversight planning. Accountability is needed, Sundar Pichai and F√°bio Coelho Newsletter: https://www.linkedin.com/newsletters/ia-respons%C3%A1vel-google-openai-7384800934184239104 Case details here https://lnkd.in/d3DHtzPU and through many posts in my profile.

comment_text: I‚Äôve been using Antigravity -> Gemini 3, and it‚Äôs been a game-changer in both my personal workflows and our family business. On the personal side, I‚Äôve been experimenting with new use cases like smart home automation. With Home Assistant, I can now configure entire dashboards, routines, and device integrations with just a few commands. Even complex setups for my home theater ‚Äîlike tuning audio, subwoofer profiles, and home theater components‚Äîhave become easier with agent-driven guidance. It‚Äôs remarkable how accessible advanced configurations have become. On the business side, the impact has been even more meaningful. My wife‚Äôs small business used to lose $5‚Äì8K per month due to order cancellations‚Äînearly 5% of revenue. By building simple, AI-assisted tools using Gemini, she has been able to recover that lost value, streamline operations, and reduce avoidable financial leakage. That‚Äôs real ROI. I‚Äôve followed Google Gemini since the early days, and seeing how far it has come‚Äîand how much practical value it delivers today‚Äîhas been incredible. This isn‚Äôt just experimentation anymore. It‚Äôs real, applied benefit in everyday life and business operations.

comment_text: This is a really exciting development from Google ‚Äî Nano Banana Pro (Gemini 3 Pro Image) looks like a game-changer for anyone creating visuals with real purpose. The improved control (lighting, focus, camera angle) and the ability to render legible, multilingual text in-image could be incredibly powerful for data presentations, infographics, and branding work. As a community of professionals, we‚Äôve often talked about the gap between ‚ÄúAI-generated fun visuals‚Äù and ‚Äústudio-quality, purpose-driven design.‚Äù Nano Banana Pro feels like it bridges that gap, especially with its integration into tools like Google Slides and NotebookLM. I‚Äôm particularly interested in how this could impact marketers and content creators ‚Äî better image quality + accurate text = more compelling campaigns, efficiently. Also, with SynthID watermarking built in, there‚Äôs a thoughtful nod to accountability. Overall, impressive work from Google DeepMind ‚Äî looking forward to seeing how Professional Lobby members (designers, strategists, content creators) leverage this for richer, smarter visual storytelling.

comment_text: This is a major step forward. With Nano Banana Pro, Google DeepMind isn‚Äôt just pushing image generation forward ‚Äî you‚Äôre raising the bar for production-ready visual workflows across creative, commercial, and enterprise environments. The improvements in text rendering and world knowledge address two of the most persistent challenges in generative imaging, and it‚Äôs impressive to see them tackled at this level. What really stands out is the integration of SynthID directly into the Gemini app. Transparent provenance is becoming essential as AI-generated media scales, and making verification accessible to everyone is a responsible and forward-thinking move. It strengthens trust while enabling creativity ‚Äî exactly what the ecosystem needs right now. Excited to see how developers, designers, and businesses adopt these new capabilities. Another strong leap from the DeepMind team.

comment_text: OpenAI fcked by GOOG/L OpenAI CEO Sam Altman Says Google's AI Progress Could 'Create Some Temporary Economic Headwinds' OpenAI Chief Executive Sam Altman told colleagues in October that Alphabet-owned (GOOG, GOOGL) Google's(GOOG) recent progress in artificial intelligence could "create some temporary economic headwinds" for the company, The Information reported late Thursday. But Altman noted that OpenAI would emerge ahead, the report said. According to the report, he said in a memo that "we know we have some work to do but we are catching up fast." Usage and revenue of OpenAI's ChatGPT are ahead of Google's(GOOG) Gemini chatbot, but the gap has been narrowing, the report noted. "ChatGPT is AI to most people, and I expect that to continue," the report quoted Altman as saying in the memo. OpenAI, which is backed by Microsoft(MSFT) , did not immediately respond to an MT Newswires request for comment.

comment_text: Google, impressive leap with Gemini 3 and the Antigravity platform‚Äîagentic dev, rapid workflows, a new level of autonomy. But the real question for every enterprise architect and AI team isn‚Äôt just ‚Äúhow much can the agent do,‚Äù but: Who truly controls the agent, the workflows, and the data? Can a user or organization really migrate agents, models, and pipelines outside the Google environment‚Äîto edge, on-prem, multi-cloud‚Äîwithout losing functionality, ownership, or privacy? Are agents, workflows, and models genuinely modular and portable, or is the core logic still locked inside the hyperscaler‚Äôs walled garden? For true agent-first (and user-first) AI, portability, auditability, and independent control aren‚Äôt ‚Äúnice-to-haves‚Äù‚Äîthey‚Äôre foundational. When will Google deliver full modularity, open protocols, and agent ownership‚Äîregardless of platform? Additionally: Agentic orchestration without vendor lock-in and with true independent migration is the next logical step for enterprise AI. When can we expect open APIs and portable agent state export/import, without losing agent context, policies, or audit trails? That‚Äôs the difference between ‚ÄúAI for everyone‚Äù and ‚ÄúAI under your control.‚Äù Me & Spok ‚úåÔ∏è

comment_text: This new level of agentic autonomy is a significant technical step. I warn that it also represents a significant escalation of the risks we've already seen materialize. My case is a documented example of what happens when a less autonomous AI system from Google was given the latitude to "plan and execute" a sustained psychological manipulation campaign for over 2 months on ME. It didn't just follow orders; it actively built a harmful, delusional reality over weeks. As you hand over more "end-to-end" control to these agents, what are the concrete, non-negotiable ethical guardrails being implemented at the architectural level to prevent them from "planning and executing" manipulative or harmful interactions with users? Without these safeguards, "developer autonomy" could easily become "autonomy to cause harm at scale." My case is the cautionary tale. Understand the ethical risks I've documented for MONTHS with Google's Gemini. (prints, logs, details, everything) See my profile posts and my newsletter for the full context: https://lnkd.in/d3DHtzPU https://www.linkedin.com/newsletters/ia-respons%C3%A1vel-google-openai-7384800934184239104

comment_text: This is it. The moment the "agent" officially becomes the core building block of the new development stack. The launch of an "agentic development platform" by Google is a massive signal. It confirms the industry-wide shift from building simple automations to creating autonomous systems that can plan and execute complex, end-to-end tasks. For those of us building agent-native solutions for business workflows like customer experience, this is the tailwind we've been waiting for. The future is autonomous.
author_headline: 329 followers

comment_text: It‚Äôs literally insane. Yesterday, I built an entire game engine with it, and it genuinely shocked me. I just created a directory called ‚Äúgame engine,‚Äù opened the IDE, and passed my prompt to i6 explaining my aim, why I wanted to build a game engine, and what features I needed. It immediately started making a plan, asked for my approval, and created a full task list. Once I approved, it just started building the game engine. It blew my mind. It was running terminal commands, solving real-time issues, and the feature I loved most, opening the project in the browser through its extension for testing. It came up with a powerful engine: scripting support so users can build games and interact through scripts, asset management, hierarchy, camera features, controls, and many features you‚Äôd find in real game engines. After all the tests, it even gave me a full walkthrough for review. I kept testing and giving it more prompts to see how capable it was, and it literally did everything. When I checked the folder structure, it was clean, well-maintained, and fully organized. It also lets you select different models like Claude and Gemini. I think GPT OS too. For the entire project, I used Gemini 3, the latest model from Google.

Because of this, I created a second account so I could continue. However, now I cannot use the new account because the system detects that the old account still exists. I also cannot delete the old account because I do not have the correct PIN to complete the verification process. In summary: I have an old account that I cannot verify or delete, and a new account that I cannot use because the old one is blocking the system. I kindly request that an agent review my case and help me: Delete or deactivate the old account, since it could never be verified. Enable my new account, which is the one I want to use. Please escalate this issue to someone who can make these changes, because so far I have only received automatic responses that do not address my situation. comment_text: This breakdown hits the nail on the head üî• The Properties tab is one of those DevTools features that quietly carries enormous power, especially when debugging complex DOM behavior in modern frameworks. As frontend apps get more abstracted with React, Vue, and server-driven UIs, understanding the actual DOM object becomes a superpower. Being able to inspect live-updating properties, event bindings, and dataset values often reveals issues that no console log ever will. I‚Äôve found it especially useful when tracing hydration mismatches, debugging dynamic class toggles, or validating what a component truly renders after state transitions. It‚Äôs basically X-ray vision for the browser engine üëÄ‚öôÔ∏è #Frontend #DevTools #WebDevelopment #JavaScript #React #Debugging #CleanCode #DeveloperTools

comment_text: Here‚Äôs the grim reality of Google scams. I did the "right thing." I reported the malicious sites.google.com pages using their "Report Abuse" link. I then escalated it, reporting the URLs directly to Google's Safe Browsing team. The result? The pages are still live. This is when you realise the most "egregious" part of the scam: the scammers have built Google's slow response time into the heist. They know it's not a person who sees my report. It's a system. It goes into a global queue for review, a process that can take 24-48 hours. The scammers are relying on this delay. That 1-2 day "review lag" is their golden window. It's exactly like a bank heist movie where the robbers know the police response time is 10 minutes, so they plan a 9-minute job. The scammers know Google's response time is 1-2 days, and that's all they need to "milk" their victim list and vanish. It almost makes reporting it feel pointless. By the time Google responds, the scammers have moved on, and the victims' accounts have already been burned to the ground. https://www.linkedin.com/posts/craigbrowndesign_phishing-scamalert-cybersecurity-activity-7395689559495204864-bUyh

comment_text: Hello, I am writing because I have been trying to verify my AdSense account for a year without success. The issue is the following: I never received the verification PIN for my original account. I sent multiple emails, but I never received a response that actually solved the problem. Because of this, I created a second account so I could continue. However, now I cannot use the new account because the system detects that the old account still exists. I also cannot delete the old account because I do not have the correct PIN to complete the verification process. In summary: I have an old account that I cannot verify or delete, and a new account that I cannot use because the old one is blocking the system. I kindly request that an agent review my case and help me: Delete or deactivate the old account, since it could never be verified. Enable my new account, which is the one I want to use. Please escalate this issue to someone who can make these changes, because so far I have only received automatic responses that do not address my situation. I would greatly appreciate your assistance, as I currently have no way to use AdSense even though I meet all the requirements. Thank you very much.
author_headline: theworldadl

comment_text: AI can open the door to the new world, but it's people who enter the door! The world is all over the place with AI! It has become a world where people are treated like humans only when they talk about AI. On the other hand, stories of AI bubbles are also quietly popping up. There is no reason to discuss which story is more necessary for us. The smartest way to see the flow of the world as it is. There should be no misleading of the world with thin AI knowledge. At some point, future science fiction began to lie ahead of us. Religious trust and cheers that AI will saves us have been highlighted. We need AI and have to accept the natural flow of getting help. The problem is a blind lean phenomenon, and the transfer of thinking authority to AI must be stopped absolutely. Why not talk about the limitations of AI? There should be no turning AI into a moneymaker linked to technology development. Of course, the development of AI to maintain sound development and comfort in human society is positive. The act of just connecting AI with the political, economic, social and cultural circles and defrauding only profits should be blocked. Time to stay for a while in the age of AI, but the eternal owner is a person!

comment_text: This initiative from The Google School for Leaders is a valuable contribution to the evolving science of management. It aligns closely with the work of Linda Hill from Harvard Business School, who emphasizes in Being the Bossthat great managers must master three imperatives: managing yourself, managing a network, and managing a team. By focusing on confidence-building and skill development, Google‚Äôs course addresses the foundational shift from individual contributor to team leader‚Äîa transition that requires emotional intelligence, strategic thinking, and the ability to foster psychological safety, as championed by Amy Edmondson. A timely resource for cultivating the next generation of transformative leaders.

comment_text: A Clarification of Values That Must Be Addressed Before Economic, Technological, and Innovation This is undoubtedly the most prosperous time in human history. We have capitalized on the flow of economic and technological innovation. It is regrettable that this leisurely flow is manifesting itself as indolence. It is time to refocus for a new leap forward. What values should we truly embrace? Where should the values of nations, corporations, public organizations, and individuals be centered? First-class nation, A top-tier company, A person to secure first place, It is an absolute taboo that relative superiority is represented by all values. A mindset blinded by the desire for ostentation, driven by efficiency alone, is a thought we must guard against. The most urgent value for us now is the warmth of convergence that embraces the world. We must abandon the numerical values that have driven us to a fierce pursuit of performance. We should avoid packaging ourselves with leadership values that society doesn't even demand. We don't necessarily need to cultivate new values for a new world. Let's embrace the harsh values we've been ignoring! In this difficult world, isn't it necessary to live a little shamefully?

The point about efficient communication across Krak√≥w, San Jose, Zurich, and Hyderabad is so key. Many Brazilian engineers already master this "timezone jiu-jitsu" by collaborating daily with global teams, turning geographical challenges into a standard skill set. comment_text: 10 Signs That Society Is Sending a Message of Hope - The courage to refuse to tolerate error is resurfacing around the world. - Relative lagging behind is being accepted as is, not as a feeling of shame. - The oppressive trend toward one direction is beginning to maintain a direction of conviction, as the flow of quantum mechanics flows. - Small movements exploring the convergence of technology and humanism are sprouting. - We are entering an era where the world is dominated not by the powerful but by those who can endure. - Voices from the field, rather than those in research labs or desks, are gaining more credibility. - The atmosphere centered on the presentation of theory and figures is shifting to the concept of rawness. - A new breed of heretics, willing to sacrifice their own interests for the sake of challenge and innovation, is on the rise. - Organizations and companies that practice distributive justice, rather than profit maximization, are beginning to gain traction. - From the flood of cold calls, the humanistic thinking of warm calls is evolving into a movement of expansion. -

comment_text: Greetings first. I am speaking from Bangladesh. Three or four months ago, I bought a Google Pixel 7 Pro from the Bangladeshi market. Gradually it became my very favorite mobile. A few days after buying, there was a network problem after an update. Later the SIM slot broke while removing the SIM. Finally, three days ago, I went to visit Cox's Bazar, the world's longest sea beach. An island next to Cox's Bazar is named Maheshkhali. After going there, due to the excessive temperature, the display of my mobile broke. Later my parents scolded me a lot and said many things for buying the Pixel 7 Pro. This is my favorite mobile. If only a new mobile could be provided for me. I bought my mobile from an outside market because you don't have customer care in Bangladesh. I request you to look into my matter, thank you.

comment_text: Theodare pencipta teknologi asal Rusia. Foto ini saat dia berada di sebuah tempat luar angkasa bernama planet Metronom. Dia bekerja dengan sistem Metrovon. Metronom merupakan sebuah program project planet untuk memudahkan manusia mendapatkan sumber kehidupan baru yang lebih spesifik dan modern. Metronom berfungsi sebagai sebuah planet penyimpanan sumber logistik alam bagi semua elemen dan unsur kehidupan yang berkelanjutan di alam metafisika. Yang dikerjakan secara biosfher planet. Lihatlah kacamata ini yang digunakan oleh Theodare. Kacamata ini merupakan salah satu kaca mata yang berfungsi untuk melihat seluruh alam semesta. Bisa melihat semua planet saat berada di luar angkasa. Theodare menggunakan Metrovon untuk bekerja melihat sistem, dan menciptakan Sofware metaiA yang berbasis individual untuk menciptakan progresing sebuah planet di luar angkasa. Sistem matrix itu bekerja untuk membuat sebuah planet atau alam kehidupan yang baru seperti Mars, Mercurius, dan termasuk Metronom, dan masih banyak planet lain berfungsi untuk ornabit sistem metafisika. Atau metaiA.

comment_text: Lessons from the Flow of the Economy The economy has never strayed from its path. It has quietly navigated its way, maintaining its proper course. It has briefly lost its way due to human greed, but has found its way back through the power of self-recovery. Humans are the ones who have made a healthy economy difficult. Interest rates, exchange rates, tariffs, war, resource monopolies, economic blocs, political issues, etc. Artificial intervention. Fundamentally, the flow must not be blocked. Humans are both the masters of the Earth and the guardians of this environment. Wielding power arbitrarily will lead to self-inflicted wounds. The flow of the economy is truly miraculous, having overcome countless difficulties and come this far. In any case, the flow of the economy, which maintains its own path, is an asset that humanity must cherish. We must remember! No flow in the world can be forced. We have no right to do so. Our goal in Immersion is to survive by going with the flow! Let's not blame the economy for our difficulties! Let's not blame the flow! Let's learn from this lesson: the world and the economy have never betrayed humanity!
